newsitem.title: USA: U.S. STOCKS SKID LOWER, NYSE SETS TRADING CURBS.
newsitem.headline: U.S. STOCKS SKID LOWER, NYSE SETS TRADING CURBS.

text.p: Wall Street shares slid to fresh session lows in afternoon trading Monday, hurt by rising bond yields and nervousness ahead of a rash of economic data due later in the week.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which buckled Friday as bond prices tumbled, was off 62 points at 7969. Its decline prompted the New York Stock Exchange to set curbs on index arbitrage trading at 1359 EDT/1759 GMT.
The long bond led the way lower, losing 21/32 to yield 6.69 percent. Nasdaq fell 28 points to 1571.
